}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function which sorts the given vector of integers
in ascending order according to the sum of their digits.
Note: if there are several items with similar sum of their digits,
order them based on their index in original vector.

For example:
>>> ordEr_by_PointS({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> ordEr_by_PointS({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> ordEr_by_PointS(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        int sum=0;
        for(int j=0;j<nums.size();j++){
            if(nums[i]==nums[j]){
                sum+=nums[j];
            }
        }
        if(sum>0){
            res.push_back(sum);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many.

    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x

    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)

        }
    }
    return sum;
}

vector<int> sorT_thiRd(vector<int> l){

<|endoftext|>/*
Return sorted unique comMon elements for two vectors.
>>> comMon({1, 4, 3, 34, 653, 2, 5}, {5, 7, 1, 5, 9, 653, 121})
{1, 5, 653}
>>> comMon({5, 3, 2, 8}, {3, 2})
{2, 3}

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> comMon(vector<int> l1,vector<int> l2){
    vector<int> com;
    sort(l1.begin(),l1.end());
    sort(l2.begin(),l2.end());
    for(int i=0;i<l1.size();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<l2.size();j++){
            if(l1[i]==l2[j]){
                com.push_back(l1[i]);
            }
        }
    }
    return com;
}
